item.title: Advanced jq
item.description: Original article https://stedolan.github.io/jq/manual/#foreach/h3/code options 1 2 3 4 5 Â· --compact-output / -c: By default, jq pretty-prints JSON output. Using this option will result in more compact output by instead putting each JSON object on a single line. stream 1 jq -n '[{foo:"bar"},{foo:"baz"}]' | jq -cn --stream 'fromstream(1|truncate_stream(inputs))' {"foo":"bar"} {"foo":"baz"} generate some json 1 [{foo:"bar"},{foo:"baz"}] [ { "foo": "bar" }, { "foo": "baz" } ] Convert the json to stream 1 fromstream(1|truncate_stream(inputs)) {"foo":"bar"} {"foo":"baz"} Explanation --stream turns the json into a list of the paths to the values.
